item.description: Biography Lena Smith is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. Her research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. She leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks. item.title: Markdown Cheat Sheet

This note demonstrates some of what Markdown is capable of doing.

Note: Feel free to play with this page. Unlike regular notes, this doesn’t automatically save itself.

item.title: Using the gallery shortcode
item.description: This way you can easily include a gallery into your page. Copy the code below into your content file and enter the relative paths to your images.

item.title: Formulas with MathJax
item.description: Mathematical equations in form of LaTeX or MathML code can be rendered with the support of MathJax. MathML works out of the box. If you’re using LaTeX you need to wrap your equation with $$ as shown in the following example:

item.title: How to add pages to the menu
item.description: I’m a linked post in the menu. You can add other posts by adding the following line to the frontmatter: menu = "main"

item.title: R Notebook
item.description: This is my R Markdown Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. Try executing this chunk by clicking the Run button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing Ctrl+Shift+Enter. plot(cars) Add a new chunk by clicking the Insert Chunk button on the toolbar or by pressing Ctrl+Alt+I. When you save the notebook, an HTML file containing the code and output will be saved alongside it (click the Preview button or press Ctrl+Shift+K to preview the HTML file).
